page.title: 01STOBSHIEL AND KIDLAW
page.content: Primarily undulating arable farmland this is a very attractive area. The roads have wide grass verges and are lined with either neatly trimmed beech hedging, hawthorn hedging or dry stone walls. The farmland is very fertile and the major crop is barley. Stobshiel farm appears to be the largest and most affluent in the area. There are shelter belts of deciduous and coniferous trees and some new planting of conifers. Longnewton is the largest settlement with 6 2-storey marled houses and 3 stone cottages and a telephone kiosk. A recently commissioned electricity power line follows the valley of the Birns Water, concealing the pylons from long distance views.
